snippet: New York’s elected officials are talking about a topic that has been close to unmentionable during the presidential campaign.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column applauds fact that New York's elected officials have revived debate about climate change, a topic that has been kept quiet during the presidential election, in light of Hurricane Sandy; climate change issue was cited by Mayor Michael R Bloomberg in his endorsement of Pres Obama for re-election, following the storm.
lead_paragraph: New York’s elected officials are talking about a topic that has been close to unmentionable during the presidential campaign.

headline.print_headline: In a Flood-Troubled City, a Refreshing Argument About Climate Change
headline.seo: A Refreshing Argument About Climate Change and What to Do About It
headline.main: In a Flood-Troubled City, a Refreshing Argument About Climate Change
